dct_title_s: Pilot Chart of the North Atlantic Ocean
dct_alternative_sm: Current Chart of the North Atlantic Ocean - July Covering the track of low-powered steamers between the straits of Florida and the English channel
dct_description_sm: Prepared from data furnished by the Hydrographic Office of the Navy Department and by the Weather Bureau of the Department of Agriculture.
Shows wind roses and current directions.
Includes 2 insets; current chart on verso.

Charts, tables, and legends: Explanation of Symbols; U.S. storm warnings [explaining flags]; key to the July storm tracks of the north Atlantic Ocean; Equator crossings for sailing passages in the Pacific Ocean ; Storm signals; maximum drif.

Text under headings: Ocean weather observation stations; The Hydrographic Office and the Merchant Marine; Naval Radio direction-finder station, Sandy Hook N.J.; average conditinos of wind and weather over the North Atlantic Ocean during July; North Atlantic lane routes - Canada/United States ; Note to observers ; [H.O.] Office publications obtainable at the Panama Canal; Errors of U.S. Naval observatory time signals; Ocean currents; Currents of the Atlantic Ocean; the Gulf Stream ; Plan of current chart.
"This chart should not be used for navigational purposes."
